intro: Rhopalopilia poggei, commonly known as the Pogge's rhopalopilia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
